topics_and_summary.models.topics module¶

topics_and_summary.models.topics.prepare_corpus(documents) → Tuple[gensim.corpora.dictionary.Dictionary, List[List[Tuple[int, int]]]][source]¶

Given a list of documents, returns a term dictionary (dictionary) and a document-term matrix (corpus).

Parameters

documents – List of documents. Each document is a list of words, where each word is a string.

Returns

2 things: Term’s dictionary (it’s attribute token2id is a dict mapping words to numeric identifiers) and Document-term matrix (a list, where each element is a list of tuples. Each tuple contains the index of a word and the number of times that word appears in that document).

topics_and_summary.models.topics.get_corpus(dictionary, documents) → List[List[Tuple[int, int]]][source]¶

Returns a corpus/document-term matrix, that consists on a list, where each element is a list of tuples. Each list of tuples represents a document, and each tuple contains the index of a word in that document and the number of times that word appears in that document.

Parameters

  • dictionary – gensim.corpora.Dictionary object.

  • documents – List of lists of strings. Each one of the nested lists represents a document, and the strings the words in that document.

Returns

Returns a corpus/document-term matrix, that consists on a list, where each element is a list of tuples.

class topics_and_summary.models.topics.TopicsModel(dataset: topics_and_summary.datasets.common.Dataset, dictionary: gensim.corpora.dictionary.Dictionary = None, corpus: List[List[Tuple[int, int]]] = None, num_topics=20, model=None, docs_topics_df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class that represents a topics model.

compute_coherence_value(coherence='c_v') → float[source]¶

Calculates, stores and returns the coherence value of the topics model.

Parameters

coherence – String that represents the type of coherence to calculate. Valid values are: ‘c_v’, ‘c_uci’ and ‘c_npmi’.

Returns

The coherence value of the topics model.

save(model_name: str, path: str = None, add_metadata_to_base_name=False)[source]¶

Saves the model to disk. Also, the coherence value is computed and saved in a txt file. If docs_topics_df was generated, it’s also saved.

Parameters

  • model_name – Name of the model.

  • path – Path were the models will be stored.

  • add_metadata_to_base_name – If True, the number of topics, the coherence value and the current time are added at the end of the model name.

classmethod load(model_name: str, model_parent_dir_path: str = None, dataset_path: str = None)[source]¶

Loads the model with the given name from the specified path, and returns a TopicsModel instance.

Parameters

  • model_name – Model name.

  • model_parent_dir_path – Path to the directory where the model folder is in.

  • dataset_path – Path to the folder that contains the original dataset documents.

Returns

Instance of a TopicsModel object.

print_topics(num_keywords=10, pretty_format=False)[source]¶

Prints the topics of the topics model.

Parameters

  • num_keywords – Number of keywords of each topic to be printed.

  • pretty_format – If False, topics are printed in the gensim way. If True, are printed using the __str__ methods of the Topic and Keywords classes.

get_topics(num_keywords=10) → List[topics_and_summary.models.topics.Topic][source]¶

Returns a list of the topics and it’s keywords (keyword name and keyword probability). Keywords inside a topic are ordered by it’s probability inside that topic.

Parameters

num_keywords – Number of keywords of each topic.

Returns

List of Topics objs.

get_topic(topic: int, num_keywords=10) → topics_and_summary.models.topics.Topic[source]¶

Returns a list of the topic keywords (keyword name and keyword probability). Keywords are ordered by it’s probability inside the topic.

Parameters

  • topic – Topic id.

  • num_keywords – Number of keywords to retrieve.

Returns

Topic obj.

predict_topic_prob_on_text(text: str, num_best_topics: int = None, print_table=True) → List[Tuple[int, float]][source]¶

Predicts the probability of each topic to be related to the given text. The probabilities sum 1. When the probability of a topic is very high, the other topics may not appear in the results.

Parameters

  • text – Text.

  • num_best_topics – Number of topics to return. If is None, returns all the topics that the model returns.

  • print_table – If True, this method also prints a table with the topics indices, their probabilities, and their keywords.

Returns

Topic probability vector.

get_related_docs_as_df(text: str, num_docs=5, remove_duplicates=True) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶
Given a text, this method returns a df with the index and the content of the most similar documents in the corpus. The similar/related documents are obtained as follows:

  1. Obtain the topics more related with the given text.

  2. Obtain the documents more related with the topics obtained in step 1.

The returned df contains the documents indices, it’s content, and the probability of that document being related with the given text (with the topics and the documents we have). That probability is obtained as follows: Probability of the text being related with the topic * Probability that the document influence the topic.

Parameters

  • text – String.

  • num_docs – Number of related documents to retrieve.

  • remove_duplicates – If True, duplicate documents are not present in the returned DataFrame. Even so, num_docs documents are returned, obtained from below of the removed documents (the documents are ordered descending).

Returns

The pandas DataFrame.

get_dominant_topic_of_each_doc_as_df() → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Returns a pandas DataFrame with the dominant topic of each document. The df has the following columns: Doc index, Dominant topic index, Topic prob,Topic keywords, Doc text. This method can take to much time to execute if the dataset is big.

Returns

pandas DataFrame.

get_k_most_repr_docs_per_topic_as_df(k=1, remove_duplicates=True) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Returns a DataFrame where the topics are grouped in ascending order by their indices, and inside each topic group there are k rows, where each row contains the topic and one of the most representative documents of that topic, in descending order.

Parameters

  • k – Number of the most representative documents per topic you want.

  • remove_duplicates – If True, duplicate documents are not present in the same topic in the returned DataFrame. Even so, k documents per topic are returned, obtained from below of the removed documents (the documents are ordered descending).

Returns

A pandas DataFrame with the following columns: Topic index, Doc index, Topic prob, Topic keywords and Doc text.

get_k_most_repr_docs_of_topic_as_df(topic: int, k=1, remove_duplicates=True) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Returns a DataFrame with the k most representative documents of the given topic. The DataFrame has k rows, where each row contains the document index, the document-topic probability and the document text, in descending order.

Parameters

  • topic – Index of the topic.

  • k – Number of the most representative documents of the topic you want.

  • remove_duplicates – If True, duplicate documents are not present in the returned DataFrame. Even so, k documents are returned, obtained from below of the removed documents (the documents are ordered descending).

Returns

A pandas DataFrame with the following columns: Doc index, Topic prob and Doc text.

get_topic_distribution_as_df() → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Returns a DataFrame where each row contains a topic, the number of documents of that topic (the topic is the dominant topic of those documents), and the percentage of documents of that topic.

Returns

A pandas DataFrame with the following columns: Dominant topic index, Num docs, Percentage docs and Topic keywords.

get_doc_topic_prob_matrix() → numpy.ndarray[source]¶
Returns

Returns a numpy matrix where the rows are documents and columns are topics. Each cell represents the probability of the document in that row being related with the topic in that column.

get_k_kws_of_topic_as_str(topic: int, k: int) → str[source]¶
Parameters

  • topic – Topic where keywords will be obtained.

  • k – Number of keywords to be returned.

Returns

k keywords from the given topic as a str.

class topics_and_summary.models.topics.Topic(id: int, kws_as_list_of_tuples: List[Tuple[str, float]])[source]¶

Bases: object

Class that simply stores the id of a topic and a specific number of keywords obtained from that topic. It’s used for data transfer.

num_keywords() → int[source]¶
Returns

Number of keywords stored in this topic object.

as_list_of_tuples() → List[Tuple[str, float]][source]¶
Returns

Topics as a list of tuples: [(name1, prob1), (name2, prob2), …].

class topics_and_summary.models.topics.Keyword(name: str, probability: float)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class that simply stores the name of a keywords and it’s probability inside a topic. It’s used for data transfer.

as_tuple() → Tuple[str, float][source]¶
Returns

Keyword as a tuple: (name, prob).

class topics_and_summary.models.topics.LdaMalletModel(dataset: topics_and_summary.datasets.common.Dataset, dictionary: gensim.corpora.dictionary.Dictionary = None, corpus: List[List[Tuple[int, int]]] = None, num_topics=20, model=None, mallet_path: str = None, model_name: str = None, model_path: str = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: topics_and_summary.models.topics.TopicsModel

Class that encapsulates the functionality of gensim.models.wrappers.LdaMallet, making it easier to use.

save()[source]¶

Saves the mallet model to the path specified in self.model.prefix and stores in a .txt the coherence value.

classmethod load(model_name: str, model_parent_dir_path: str = None, dataset_path: str = None, mallet_path: str = None)[source]¶

Loads the model with the given name from the specified path, and returns a LdaMalletModel instance. The dataset used to create the model and the docs_topics_df (if exists) will be loaded from the model directory.

Parameters

  • model_name – Model name.

  • model_parent_dir_path – Path to the directory where the model folder is in.

  • dataset_path – Path to the folder that contains the original dataset documents.

  • mallet_path – Path to the mallet source code.

Returns

Instance of a LdaMalletModel object.

class topics_and_summary.models.topics.TopicsModelsList(dataset: topics_and_summary.datasets.common.Dataset)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for easily creating, comparing and storing a list of topics models.

create_models_and_compute_coherence_values(start=2, stop=20, step=1, coherence='c_v', print_and_plot=True, title="Topic's model coherence comparison", save_plot=False, save_plot_path=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Creates, stores and returns topics models and it’s coherence values. Can be used to determine an optimum number of topics.

Parameters

  • start – Number of topics to start looking for the optimum.

  • stop – Maximum number of topics to be tried.

  • step – Number of topics to be incremented while looking for the optimum.

  • coherence – String that represents the type of coherence to calculate. Valid values are: ‘c_v’, ‘c_uci’ and ‘c_npmi’.

  • print_and_plot – If true, prints and plots the results.

  • title – Title of the result’s plot. Ignored if print_and_plot is False.

  • save_plot – If is true and print_and_plot is True, save the plot to disk.

  • save_plot_path – If save_plot is True and print_and_plot is True, this is the path where the plot will be saved.

  • kwargs – Other keyword parameters for creating the models.

Returns

List of the created models and their corresponding coherence values.

print_and_plot_coherence_values(models_list=None, coherence_values=None, title="Topic's model coherence comparison", save_plot=False, save_plot_path: str = None)[source]¶

Prints and plots coherence values of the specified models.

Parameters

  • models_list – List of models. If is None, self.models_list is used.

  • coherence_values – List of coherence values. If is None, self.coherence_values is used.

  • title – Title of the plot.

  • save_plot – If is True, save the plot to disk.

  • save_plot_path – If save_plot is True, this is the path where the plot will be saved. Must end in ‘.png’ or ‘.pdf’.

save(base_name: str, path: str = None, index: int = None)[source]¶

If index parameter is None, saves all the models to disk. If is a number, saves only the model with that index.

Parameters

  • base_name – Base name of the models. After it, the current time, the number of topics, and the coherence value are added.

  • path – Path were the models will be stored.

  • index – Index of the model to be saved. If is none, saves all models.

class topics_and_summary.models.topics.LdaMalletModelsList(dataset: topics_and_summary.datasets.common.Dataset)[source]¶

Bases: topics_and_summary.models.topics.TopicsModelsList

Class for easily creating, comparing and storing a list of LdaMalletModels.

create_models_and_compute_coherence_values(start=2, stop=20, step=1, coherence='c_v', print_and_plot=True, title="Topic's model coherence comparison", save_plot=False, save_plot_path: str = None, models_base_name='mallet_model', **kwargs)[source]¶

Creates, stores and returns topics models and it’s coherence values. Can be used to determine an optimum number of topics.

Parameters

  • start – Number of topics to start looking for the optimum.

  • stop – Maximum number of topics to be tried.

  • step – Number of topics to be incremented while looking for the optimum.

  • coherence – String that represents the type of coherence to calculate. Valid values are: ‘c_v’, ‘c_uci’ and ‘c_npmi’.

  • print_and_plot – If true, prints and plots the results.

  • title – Title of the result’s plot. Ignored if print_and_plot is False.

  • save_plot – If is true and print_and_plot is True, save the plot to disk.

  • save_plot_path – If save_plot is True and print_and_plot is True, this is the path where the plot will be saved.

  • models_base_name – Base name for the Mallet models. This param + num_topics of each model is passed to the LdaMalletModel __init__ method, because is needed for storing the files of the model.

  • kwargs – Other keyword parameters for creating the models.

Returns

List of the created models and their corresponding coherence values.

save(index: int = None)[source]¶

If index parameter is None, saves all the models to disk. If is a number, saves only the model with that index.

Parameters

index – Index of the model to be saved. If is none, saves all models.
